title: Rendang Curry Paste
source: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
categories: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
ingredients: 24dried Thai chilies, stems removed and seeded
¼cup chopped candlenuts or macadamia nuts
directions: 1. Grind the dry chilies, in batches if necessary, in a spice grinder (coffee grinder) to a fine powder.

2. Combine the shallots, garlic, lemongrass, and galangal in the bowl of a food processor and process until coarsely chopped, adding a few ice cubes if needed to get the mixture going. Add the chilies, nuts, peppercorns, turmeric, and salt and continue to process until a smooth paste forms, stopping and scraping the side and bottom of the bowl a few times and adding a few more ice cubes if needed. This process can take about 5 minutes to create a smooth paste. Scrape the paste into a bowl. The paste can be made up to this point and stored in the refrigerator, tightly covered, for 3 days and up to 3 months in the freezer.
